intro: Tetratheca thymifolia var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. It is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. This variant is distinguished by its broader leaves compared to the typical form of Tetratheca thymifolia.
